data.why:
I have written a module named SVGLAB, which draws SVG pictures in
    MATLAB style. It's definitely different from the exist SVG module.
    e.g: line(x1,y1,x2,y2); #generates a SVG file contains SVG <line>
    object.rect(),circle(),and so on,alike. plot($x,$y);#generates a
    function figure, e.g, a Sine function. One can use only two words to
    create a SVG picture: figure; #drawing code figend; If there is
    ,say, 10 figure-figend pairs inside a script, then 10 pictures will
    be created. One never concerns about the axis. That's to say, for
    e.g, one can draw a line from (-1,-1) to (0,0), and he will see a
    line inside the picture. More features in the module.
